sentences: Riigi aadelkonna privileegid olid ajalooliselt väga laialdased.
Eestimaa ja Liivimaa riigi esindajad kohtusid regulaarselt.
Aadelkonna liikmed said oma staatuse pärast riigi ees kaitset.
context: The word 'riigi' is the genitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'riik', meaning 'state'. In this context, it appears to refer to 'the state's nobility' or 'of the state/government'. The dictionary definition specifically mentions it as referring to 'the organized nobility/ aristocracy of a region/state' with privileges. It can also be interpreted as possessive, indicating something belonging to the state or government.
